statements.name: PROC X12
statements.description: The X12 procedure, an adaptation of the U.S. Bureau of the Census X-12-ARIMA Seasonal Adjustment program (U.S. Bureau of the Census; 2001c), seasonally adjusts monthly or quarterly time series. The procedure makes additive or multiplicative adjustments and creates an output data set that contains the adjusted time series and intermediate calculations. † The X-12-ARIMA program combines the capabilities of the X-11 program (Shiskin, Young, and Musgrave; 1967) and the X-11-ARIMA/88 program (Dagum; 1988) and also introduces some new features (Findley et al.; 1998). One of the main enhancements involves the use of a regARIMA model, a regression model with ARIMA (autoregressive integrated moving average) errors. Thus, the X-12-ARIMA program contains methods developed by both the U.S. Census Bureau and Statistics Canada. In addition, the X-12-ARIMA automatic modeling routine is based on the TRAMO (time series regression with ARIMA noise, missing values, and outliers) method (Gomez and Maravall; 1997a, 1997b). The four major components of the X-12-ARIMA program are regARIMA modeling, model diagnostics, seasonal adjustment that uses enhanced X-11 methodology, and post-adjustment diagnostics. Statistics Canada’s X-11 method fits an ARIMA model to the original series, and then uses the model forecast to extend the original series. This extended series is then seasonally adjusted by the standard X-11 seasonal adjustment method. The extension of the series improves the estimation of the seasonal factors and reduces revisions to the seasonally adjusted series as new data become available.

arguments.name: AUXDATA=
arguments.description: [Experimental feature] Specifies an auxiliary input data set that contains user-defined variables, which are specified in the INPUT statement, the USERVAR= option of the REGRESSION statment, or the USERDEFINED statement. The AUXDATA= data set can also contain the date variable, which is specified in the DATE= option in the PROC X12 statement. If the date variable is present, then the date variable is used to align the observations in the auxiliary data set to the observations in the series that is being processed. The date values must be sorted in ascending order with no gaps or duplications, and the interval must match the interval of the series. If the date variable is not present or valid, then observations in the auxiliary data set are matched by observation number to the series that is being processed. The auxiliary data set does not support BY-group processing. The variables in the auxiliary data set are applied to all BY groups, where the dates of the BY group correspond to the dates of the auxiliary data set.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies the input SAS data set used. If this option is omitted, the most recently created SAS data set is used.

arguments.name: DATE=
arguments.description: Specifies a variable that gives the date for each observation. Unless specified in the SPAN= option, the starting and ending dates are obtained from the first and last values of the DATE= variable, which must contain SAS date or datetime values.

arguments.name: INEVENT=
arguments.description: Specifies the input data set that defines any user-defined event variables. This option can be omitted if events are not specified or if only SAS predefined events are specified in an EVENT statement.

arguments.name: INTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the frequency of the input time series.
arguments.help: INTERVAL=DAY | HOUR | MINUTE | SECOND | WEEK | MONTH | YEAR | QTR | TENDAY | SEMIMONTH | SEMIYEAR

arguments.name: DAY
arguments.description: DAY interval

arguments.name: HOUR
arguments.description: HOUR interval

arguments.name: MINUTE
arguments.description: MINUTE interval

arguments.name: SECOND
arguments.description: SECOND interval

arguments.name: WEEK
arguments.description: WEEK interval

arguments.name: MONTH
arguments.description: MONTH interval

arguments.name: YEAR
arguments.description: YEAR interval

arguments.name: QTR
arguments.description: QTR interval

arguments.name: TENDAY
arguments.description: TENDAY interval

arguments.name: SEMIMONTH
arguments.description: SEMIMONTH interval

arguments.name: SEMIYEAR
arguments.description: SEMIYEAR interval

arguments.name: MDLINFOIN=
arguments.description: Specifies an optional input data set that contains model information that can replace the information contained in the TRANSFORM, REGRESSION, ARIMA, and AUTOMDL statements.

arguments.name: MDLINFOOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the optional output data set that contains the transformation, regression, and ARIMA information related to each seasonally adjusted series. The data set is sorted by the BY-group variables, if any, and by series names. The MDLINFOOUT= data set can be used as input for the MDLINFOIN= option.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses any printed output.

arguments.name: NOTRIMMISS
arguments.description: Suppresses the default, by which leading and trailing missing values are trimmed from the series. If NOTRIMMISS is used, PROC X12 automatically generates missing value regressors for any missing value within the span of the series, including leading and trailing missing values.

arguments.name: OUTSTAT=
arguments.description: Specifies an optional output data set which contains the summary statistics that related to each seasonally adjusted series. The data set is sorted by the BY-group variables, if any, and by series names.

arguments.name: PERIODOGRAM
arguments.description: Specifies that the PERIODOGRAM rather than the spectrum of the series be plotted in the G tables and plots. If PERIODOGRAM is not specified, then the SPECTRUM is plotted in the G tables.

arguments.name: PLOTS=
arguments.description: controls the plots that are produced through ODS Graphics. Syntax: PLOTS<(global-plot-options)> <= plot-request <(options)>> PLOTS<(global-plot-options)> <= (plot-request <(options)> <... plot-request <(options)>>)> The global-plot-options apply to all relevant plots that are generated by the X12 procedure. The following global-plot-option is supported:
arguments.help: PLOTS=ALL | NONE | SERIES | RESIDUAL | SA | IC

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Produces all plots that are appropriate for the particular analysis.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses all plots.

arguments.name: SERIES
arguments.description: Syntax: SERIES(<series-plot-options>) Produces plots that are associated with the identification stage of the modeling. The ACF, PACF, and SPECTRUM plots are produced by default. The following series-plot-options are available: ACF produces the plot of autocorrelations. ALL produces all the plots that are associated with the identification stage. NONE suppresses all plots that are associated with the identification stage. PACF produces the plot of partial-autocorrelations. SPECTRUM produces the spectral plot of Table G0. Table G0 is calculated based on either Table A1, A19, B1 or E1, as specified by the SPECTRUMSERIES= option.

arguments.name: RESIDUAL
arguments.description: Syntax: RESIDUAL(<residual-plot-options>) Produces the regARIMA model residual series plots if the CHECK statement is specified. The ACF, PACF, HIST, SQACF, and SPECTRUM plots are produced by default. The following residual-plot-options are available: ACF produces the plot of residual autocorrelations. ALL produces all the residual diagnostics plots that are appropriate for the particular analysis. HIST produces the histogram of the residuals and also the residual outliers and residual statistics tables that describe the residual histogram. NONE suppresses all the residual diagnostics plots. PACF produces the plot of residual partial-autocorrelations if PRINT=PACF is specified in the CHECK statement. SPECTRUM produces the spectral plot of Table GRs. Table GRs is calculated based on the regARIMA model residual series. SQACF produces the plot of squared residual autocorrelations.

arguments.name: SA
arguments.description: Syntax: SA(<sa-plot-options>) | ADJUSTED(<sa-plot-options>) Produces the seasonally adjusted series plots in the X11 statement. The SPECTRUM plot is produced by default. The following sa-plot-options are available: ALL produces all seasonally adjusted plots. NONE suppresses all seasonally adjusted plots. SPECTRUM produces the spectral plot of Table G1. Table G1 is calculated based on the modified seasonally adjusted series (Table E2).

arguments.name: IC
arguments.description: Syntax: IC(<ic-plot-options>) | IRREGULAR(<ic-plot-options>) Produces the irregular series plots in the X11 statement. The SPECTRUM plot is produced by default. The following ic-plot-options are available: ALL produces all irregular plots. NONE suppresses all irregular plots. SPECTRUM produces the spectral plot of Table G2. Table G2 is calculated based on the modified irregular series (Table E3).

arguments.name: SEASONS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of observations in a seasonal cycle. If the SEASONS= option is not specified and INTERVAL=QTR, then SEASONS=4 is assumed. If the SEASONS= option is not specified and INTERVAL=MONTH, then SEASONS=12 is assumed. If the SEASONS= option is specified, its value should not conflict with the values of the INTERVAL= option or the values of the date variable.

arguments.name: SPAN=
arguments.description: Specifies the dates of the first and last observations to define a subset for processing. A single date in parentheses is interpreted to be the starting date of the subset. To specify only the ending date, use SPAN=(,mmmyy).

arguments.name: SPECTRUMSERIES=
arguments.description: Specifies the table name of the series that is used in the spectrum of the original series (table G0). The table names that can be specified are A1, A19, B1, or E1. The default is B1.

arguments.name: START=
arguments.description: Specifies the date of the first observation. Unless the SPAN= option is used, the starting and ending dates are the dates of the first and last observations, respectively.

statements.name: ADJUST
statements.description: The ADJUST statement adjusts the series for leap year and length-of-period factors prior to estimating a regARIMA model. The "Prior Adjustment Factors" table is associated with the ADJUST statement.

arguments.name: PREDEFINED=
arguments.description: Specifies length-of-month adjustment, length-of-quarter adjustment, or leap year adjustment.

arguments.name: LOM
arguments.description: Specifies length-of-month adjustment.

arguments.name: LOQ
arguments.description: Specifies length-of-quarter adjustment.

arguments.name: LPYEAR
arguments.description: Specifies eap year adjustment.

statements.name: ARIMA
statements.description: The ARIMA statement specifies the ARIMA part of the regARIMA model. This statement defines a pure ARIMA model if no REGRESSION statements, INPUT statements, or EVENT statements are specified. The ARIMA part of the model can include multiplicative seasonal factors.

arguments.name: MODEL=
arguments.description: Specifies the ARIMA model. The format follows standard Box-Jenkins notation (Box, Jenkins, and Reinsel; 1994). The nonseasonal AR and MA orders are given by p and q, respectively, while the seasonal AR and MA orders are given by P and Q. The number of differences and seasonal differences are given by d and D, respectively. The notation (p d q) and (P D Q) can also be specified as (p, d, q) and (P, D, Q).

statements.name: AUTOMDL
statements.description: The AUTOMDL statement is used to invoke the automatic model selection procedure of the X-12-ARIMA method. This method is based largely on the TRAMO (time series regression with ARIMA noise, missing values, and outliers) method by Gomez and Maravall (1997a, 1997b).
statements.help: AUTOMDL <DIFFORDER=(nonseasonal order, seasonal order)> <MAXDIFF=(nonseasonal order, seasonal order)> <MAXORDER=(nonseasonal order, seasonal order)> ...

arguments.name: ACCEPTDEFAULT
arguments.description: Specifies that the default model be chosen if its Ljung-Box Q is acceptable.

arguments.name: ARMACV=
arguments.description: Specifies the threshold value for the t statistics associated with the highest order ARMA coefficients.

arguments.name: BALANCED
arguments.description: Specifies that the automatic modeling procedure prefer balanced models over unbalanced models. A balanced model is one in which the sum of AR, differencing, and seasonal differencing orders equal to the sum of MA and seasonal MA orders.

arguments.name: DIFFORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the fixed orders of differencing to be used in the automatic ARIMA model identification procedure. When the DIFFORDER= option is used, only the AR and MA orders are automatically identified. Acceptable values for the regular differencing orders are 0, 1, and 2; acceptable values for the seasonal differencing orders are 0 and 1.

arguments.name: HRINITIAL
arguments.description: Specifies that Hannan-Rissanen estimation be done before exact maximum likelihood estimation to provide initial values. If HRINITIAL is specified, then models for which the Hannan-Rissanen estimation has an unacceptable coefficient are rejected.

arguments.name: LJUNGBOXLIMIT=
arguments.description: Specifies acceptance criteria for confidence coefficient of the Ljung-Box Q statistic.

arguments.name: MAXDIFF=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum orders of regular and seasonal differencing for the automatic identification of differencing orders. When MAXDIFF is specified, the differencing orders are identified first, and then the AR and MA orders are identified. Acceptable values for the regular differencing orders are 1 and 2; the only acceptable value for the seasonal differencing order is 1.

arguments.name: MAXORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum orders of nonseasonal and seasonal ARMA polynomials for the automatic ARIMA model identification procedure. The maximum order for the nonseasonal ARMA parameters should be between 1 and 4; the maximum order for the seasonal ARMA should be 1 or 2.

arguments.name: NOINT
arguments.description: Suppresses the fitting of a constant (or intercept) parameter in the model. (That is, the parameter µ is omitted.)

arguments.name: PRINT=
arguments.description: Lists the tables to be displayed in the output.

arguments.name: UNITROOTTEST
arguments.description: Causes the table titled "Results of Unit Root Test for Identifying Orders of Differencing" to be printed.

arguments.name: AUTOCHOICE
arguments.description: Displays the tables titled "Comparison of Automatically Selected Model and Default Model" and "Final Automatic Model Selection".

arguments.name: UNITROOTTESTMDL
arguments.description: Displays the table titled "ARIMA Estimates for Unit Root Identification".

arguments.name: AUTOCHOICEMDL
arguments.description: Displays the table "Models Estimated by Automatic ARIMA Model Selection Procedure".

arguments.name: BEST5MODEL
arguments.description: Displays the table "Best Five ARIMA Models Chosen by Automatic Modeling".

arguments.name: REDUCECV=
arguments.description: Specifies the percentage that the outlier critical value be reduced when a final model is found to have an unacceptable confidence coefficient for the Ljung-Box Q statistic. This value should be between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.14286.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: A BY statement can be used with PROC X12 to obtain separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables. When a BY statement appears, the procedure expects the input DATA= data set to be sorted in order of the BY variables.

statements.name: CHECK
statements.description: The CHECK statement produces statistics for diagnostic checking of residuals from the estimated regARIMA model.

arguments.name: MAXLAG=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of lags for the residual sample autocorrelation function (ACF) and partial autocorrelation function (PACF). The default is 36 for monthly series and 12 for quarterly series. The minimum value for MAXLAG= is 1.

arguments.name: PRINT=
arguments.description: Specifies the diagnostic checking tables to be displayed. If the PRINT= option is not specified, the default is equivalent to specifying PRINT=(ACF ACFSQUARED RESIDUALOUTLIER RESIDUALSTATISTICS NORM SPECRESIDUAL).
arguments.help: PRINT=ACF | PACF | ACFSQUARED | RESIDUALSTATISTICS | RESIDUALOUTLIER | NORM | SPECRESIDUAL | ALL | NONE | (*OPTIONS*)

arguments.name: ACF
arguments.description: Displays the table titled "Autocorrelation of regARIMA Model Residuals."

arguments.name: PACF
arguments.description: Displays the table titled "Partial Autocorrelation of regARIMA Model Residuals."

arguments.name: ACFSQUARED
arguments.description: Displays the table titled "Autocorrelation of Squared regARIMA Model Residuals."

arguments.name: RESIDUALSTATISTICS
arguments.description: Displays the table titled "Summary Statistics for the Unstandardized Residuals."

arguments.name: RESIDUALOUTLIER
arguments.description: Displays the table "Outliers of the Unstandardized Residuals" if the residuals contain outliers.

arguments.name: NORM
arguments.description: Displays the table titled "Normality Statistics for regARIMA Model Residuals". Measures of normality included in this table are skewness, Geary’s a statistic, and kurtosis.

arguments.name: SPECRESIDUAL
arguments.description: Displays the table titled "Table G Rs: 10*LOG(SPECTRUM) of the regARIMA Model Residuals."

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Specifies that all tables related to diagnostic checking be displayed.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: If no other PRINT= option is specified, then none of the tables that are associated with diagnostic checking are displayed. However, PRINT=NONE has no effect if other PRINT= options are specified in the CHECK statement.

arguments.name: (OPTIONS)
arguments.description: Change OPTIONS with a list of print options.

statements.name: ESTIMATE
statements.description: The ESTIMATE statement estimates the regARIMA model. The regARIMA model is specified by the REGRESSION, INPUT, EVENT, and ARIMA statements or by the MDLINFOIN= data set.

arguments.name: ITPRINT
arguments.description: Specifies that the "Iterations History" table be displayed. This includes detailed output for estimation iterations (including log-likelihood values and parameters) and counts of function evaluations and iterations.

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations (for estimating the AR and MA parameters) allowed.

arguments.name: PRINTERR
arguments.description: Causes restarted iterations to be included in the "Iterations History" table (if ITPRINT is specified) or creates the "Restarted Iterations" table (if ITPRINT is not specified).

arguments.name: TOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the convergence tolerance for the nonlinear estimation. Absolute changes in the log-likelihood are compared to the TOL= value to check convergence of the estimation iterations.

statements.name: EVENT
statements.description: The EVENT statement specifies EVENTs to be included in the regression portion of the regARIMA model. Multiple EVENT statements can be specified. If a MDLINFOIN= data set is not specified, then all variables specified in the EVENT statements are applied to all BY-groups and all time series that are processed. If a MDLINFOIN= data set is specified, then the EVENT statements applies only if no regression information for the BY-group and series is available in the MDLINFOIN= data set.

arguments.name: B=
arguments.description: Specifies initial or fixed values for the EVENT parameters. An F immediately following the numerical value indicates that this is not an initial value, but a fixed value.

arguments.name: USERTYPE=
arguments.description: Enables a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined variable.
arguments.help: USERTYPE=AO | CONSTANT | EASTER | HOLIDAY | LABOR | LOM | LOMSTOCK | LOQ | LPYEAR | LS | RP | SCEASTER | SEASONAL | TC | TD | TDSTOCK | THANKS | USER

arguments.name: AO
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined AO variable.

arguments.name: CONSTANT
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined CONSTANT variable.

arguments.name: EASTER
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined EASTER variable.

arguments.name: HOLIDAY
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined HOLIDAY variable.

arguments.name: LABOR
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LABOR variable.

arguments.name: LOM
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LOM variable.

arguments.name: LOMSTOCK
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LOMSTOCK variable.

arguments.name: LOQ
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LOQ variable.

arguments.name: LPYEAR
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LPYEAR variable.

arguments.name: LS
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LS variable.

arguments.name: RP
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined RP variable.

arguments.name: SCEASTER
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined SCEASTER variable.

arguments.name: SEASONAL
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined SEASONAL variable.

arguments.name: TC
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined TC variable.

arguments.name: TD
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined TD variable.

arguments.name: TDSTOCK
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined TDSTOCK variable.

arguments.name: THANKS
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined THANKS variable.

arguments.name: USER
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined USER variable.

statements.name: FORECAST
statements.description: The FORECAST statement uses the estimated model to forecast the time series. The output contains point forecast and forecast statistics for the transformed and original series.

arguments.name: LEAD=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of periods ahead to forecast. The default is the number of periods in a year (4 or 12), and the maximum is 60.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: If you are creating an output data set, use the ID statement to copy values of the ID variables, in addition to the table values, into the output data set. Or, if the VAR statement is omitted, all numeric variables that are not identified as BY variables, ID variables, the DATE= variable, or user-defined regressors are processed as time series.

statements.name: IDENTIFY
statements.description: The IDENTIFY statement is used to produce plots of the sample autocorrelation function (ACF) and partial autocorrelation function (PACF) for identifying the ARIMA part of a regARIMA model. The sample ACF and PACF are produced for all combinations of the nonseasonal and seasonal differences of the data specified by the DIFF= and SDIFF= options.

arguments.name: DIFF=
arguments.description: Specifies orders of nonseasonal differencing to use in model identification. The value 0 specifies no differencing; the value 1 specifies one nonseasonal difference (1-β); the value 2 specifies two nonseasonal differences (1-β^s)²; and so forth.

arguments.name: MAXLAG=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of lags for the sample autocorrelation function (ACF) and partial autocorrelation function (PACF) of the regression residuals for model identification. The default is 36 for monthly series and 12 for quarterly series. MAXLAG applies to both tables and plots. The minimum value for MAXLAG= is 1.

arguments.name: PRINTREG
arguments.description: Causes the "Regression Model Parameter Estimates" table to be printed if the REGRESSION statement is present. By default, the table is not printed.

arguments.name: SDIFF=
arguments.description: Specifies orders of seasonal differencing to use in model identification. The value 0 specifies no differencing; the value 1 specifies one nonseasonal difference (1-β); the value 2 specifies two nonseasonal differences (1-β^s)²; and so forth.

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: The INPUT statement specifies variables in the PROC X12 DATA= data set that are to be used as regressors in the regression portion of the regARIMA model.

arguments.name: B=
arguments.description: Specifies initial or fixed values for the INPUT parameters. An F immediately following the numerical value indicates that this is not an initial value, but a fixed value.

arguments.name: USERTYPE=
arguments.description: Enables a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined variable.
arguments.help: USERTYPE=AO | CONSTANT | EASTER | HOLIDAY | LABOR | LOM | LOMSTOCK | LOQ | LPYEAR | LS | RP | SCEASTER | SEASONAL | TC | TD | TDSTOCK | THANKS | USER

arguments.name: AO
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined AO variable.

arguments.name: CONSTANT
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined CONSTANT variable.

arguments.name: EASTER
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined EASTER variable.

arguments.name: HOLIDAY
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined HOLIDAY variable.

arguments.name: LABOR
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LABOR variable.

arguments.name: LOM
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LOM variable.

arguments.name: LOMSTOCK
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LOMSTOCK variable.

arguments.name: LOQ
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LOQ variable.

arguments.name: LPYEAR
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LPYEAR variable.

arguments.name: LS
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LS variable.

arguments.name: RP
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined RP variable.

arguments.name: SCEASTER
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined SCEASTER variable.

arguments.name: SEASONAL
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined SEASONAL variable.

arguments.name: TC
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined TC variable.

arguments.name: TD
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined TD variable.

arguments.name: TDSTOCK
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined TDSTOCK variable.

arguments.name: THANKS
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined THANKS variable.

arguments.name: USER
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined USER variable.

statements.name: OUTLIER
statements.description: The OUTLIER statement specifies that the X12 procedure perform automatic detection of additive (point) outliers, temporary change outliers, level shifts, or any combination of the three when using the specified model. After outliers are identified, the appropriate regression variables are incorporated into the model as "Automatically Identified Outliers," and the model is reestimated. This procedure is repeated until no additional outliers are found.

arguments.name: AOCV=
arguments.description: Specifies a critical value to use for additive (point) outliers. If AOCV is specified, this value overrides any default critical value for AO outliers.

arguments.name: CV=
arguments.description: Specifies an initial critical value to use for detection of all types of outliers. The absolute value of the t statistic associated with an outlier parameter estimate is compared with the critical value to determine the significance of the outlier. If the CV= option is not specified, then the default initial critical value is computed using a formula presented by Ljung (1993), which is based on the number of observations or model span used in the analysis.

arguments.name: LSCV=
arguments.description: Specifies a critical value to use for level shift outliers. If LSCV is specified, this value overrides any default critical value for LS outliers.

arguments.name: SPAN=
arguments.description: Gives the dates of the first and last observations to define a subset for searching for outliers. A single date in parentheses is interpreted to be the starting date of the subset. To specify only the ending date, use SPAN=(,mmmyy ) or SPAN=(,’yyQq’). If the starting or ending date is omitted, then the first or last date, respectively, of the input data set is assumed. A four-digit year can be specified; if a two-digit year is specified, the value specified in the YEARCUTOFF= SAS system option applies.

arguments.name: TCCV=
arguments.description: Specifies a critical value to use for temporary change outliers. If TCCV is specified, this value overrides any default critical value for TC outliers.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Lists the outlier types to be detected by the automatic outlier identification method. TYPE=NONE turns off outlier detection. The valid outlier types are AO, LS, and TC. The default is TYPE=(AO LS).
arguments.help: TYPE=NONE | (AO LS TC) | (AO LS) | (LS TC) | (AO TC)

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Lists no outlier types to be detected by the automatic outlier identification method.

arguments.name: (AO LS TC)
arguments.description: Lists the AO LS TC outlier types to be detected by the automatic outlier identification method.

arguments.name: (AO LS)
arguments.description: Lists AO LS outlier types to be detected by the automatic outlier identification method. This is the default.

arguments.name: (LS TC)
arguments.description: Lists LS TC outlier types to be detected by the automatic outlier identification method.

arguments.name: (AO TC)
arguments.description: Lists AO TC outlier types to be detected by the automatic outlier identification method.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: The OUTPUT statement creates an output data set that contains specified tables. The data set is named by the OUT= option.

arguments.name: A1
arguments.description: [Prior adjustments and regARIMA components (optional)] Original series

arguments.name: A10
arguments.description: [Prior adjustments and regARIMA components (optional)] RegARIMA user-defined seasonal component

arguments.name: A19
arguments.description: [Prior adjustments and regARIMA components (optional)] RegARIMA outlier adjusted original data

arguments.name: A2
arguments.description: [Prior adjustments and regARIMA components (optional)] Prior-adjustment factors

arguments.name: A6
arguments.description: [Prior adjustments and regARIMA components (optional)] RegARIMA trading day component

arguments.name: A7
arguments.description: [Prior adjustments and regARIMA components (optional)] RegARIMA holiday component

arguments.name: A8
arguments.description: [Prior adjustments and regARIMA components (optional)] RegARIMA combined outlier component

arguments.name: A8A0
arguments.description: [Prior adjustments and regARIMA components (optional)] RegARIMA AO outlier component

arguments.name: A8LS
arguments.description: [Prior adjustments and regARIMA components (optional)] RegARIMA level change outlier component

arguments.name: A8TC
arguments.description: [Prior adjustments and regARIMA components (optional)] RegARIMA temporary change outlier component

arguments.name: A9
arguments.description: [Prior adjustments and regARIMA components (optional)] RegARIMA user-defined regression component

arguments.name: B1
arguments.description: [Preliminary estimates of irregular component weights and trading day regression factors (X-11 method)] Prior-adjusted or original series

arguments.name: C17
arguments.description: [Final estimates of irregular component weights and trading day regression factors] Final weight for irregular components

arguments.name: C20
arguments.description: [inal estimates of irregular component weights and trading day regression factors] Final extreme value adjustment factors

arguments.name: D1
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Modified original data, D iteration

arguments.name: D10
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Final seasonal factors

arguments.name: D10B
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Seasonal factors, adjusted for user-defined seasonal

arguments.name: D10D
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Final seasonal difference

arguments.name: D11
arguments.description: [Final replacement values for extreme S-I ratios] Final seasonally adjusted series

arguments.name: D11A
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Final seasonally adjusted series with forced yearly totals

arguments.name: D11F
arguments.description: [Final seasonally adjusted series] Factors applied to get adjusted series with forced yearly totals

arguments.name: D11R
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Rounded final seasonally adjusted series (with forced yearly totals)

arguments.name: D12
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Final trend cycle

arguments.name: D13
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Final irregular series

arguments.name: D16
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components]

arguments.name: D16B
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Combined adjustment factors

arguments.name: D18
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Combined calendar adjustment factors

arguments.name: D7
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Preliminary trend cycle, D iteration

arguments.name: D8
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Final unmodified S-I ratios

arguments.name: D9
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Final replacement values for extreme S-I ratios

arguments.name: E1
arguments.description: [Analytical table] Original data modified for extremes

arguments.name: E2
arguments.description: [Analytical table] Modified seasonally adjusted series

arguments.name: E3
arguments.description: [Analytical table] Modified irregular series

arguments.name: E5
arguments.description: [Analytical table] Percent changes in original series

arguments.name: E6
arguments.description: [Analytical table] Percent changes in final seasonally adjusted series

arguments.name: E6A
arguments.description: [Analytical table] Percent changes (differences) in seasonally adjusted series with forced yearly totals (D11.A)

arguments.name: E6R
arguments.description: [Analytical table] Percent changes (differences) in rounded seasonally adjusted series (D11.R)

arguments.name: E7
arguments.description: [Analytical table] Differences in final trend cycle

arguments.name: E8
arguments.description: [Analytical table] Percent changes (differences) in original series adjusted for calendar factors (A18)

arguments.name: MV1
arguments.description: Original series adjusted for missing value regressors

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Names the data set to contain the specified tables. If the OUT= option is omitted, the SAS System names the new data set by using the default DATAn convention. For each table to be included in the output data set, you must specify the X12 tablename keyword. The keyword corresponds to the title label used by the Census Bureau X12-ARIMA software.

statements.name: REGRESSION
statements.description: The REGRESSION statement includes regression variables in a regARIMA model or specifies regression variables whose effects are to be removed by the IDENTIFY statement to aid in ARIMA model identification. Predefined regression variables are selected with the PREDEFINED= option. User-defined regression variables are specified with the USERVAR= option.
statements.help: REGRESSION <B=(value <F> ...)> PREDEFINED=CONSTANT< / B= >|LOM|LOMSTOCK...  USERVAR=(variables) < / B=value USERTYPE=option> ...

arguments.name: PREDEFINED=
arguments.description: Lists the predefined regression variables to be included in the model.
arguments.help: PREDEFINED=CONSTANT< / B= > | LOM | LOMSTOCK | LOQ | LPYEAR | SEASONAL | TD | TDNOLPYEAR | TD1COEF | TD1NOLPYEAR | EASTER(value) | SCEASTER(value) | LABOR(value) | THANK(value) | TDSTOCK(value) | SINCOS(value ...)

arguments.name: CONSTANT
arguments.description: Trend constant

arguments.name: LOM
arguments.description: Length-of-month (monthly flow)

arguments.name: LOMSTOCK
arguments.description: Stock length-of-month

arguments.name: LOQ
arguments.description: Length-of-quarter (quarterly flow)

arguments.name: LPYEAR
arguments.description: Leap year monthly and quarterly flow)

arguments.name: SEASONAL
arguments.description: Fixed seasonal

arguments.name: TD
arguments.description: Trading day

arguments.name: TDNOLPYEAR
arguments.description: Trading day (leap year)

arguments.name: TD1COEF
arguments.description: One coefficient trading day

arguments.name: TD1NOLPYEAR
arguments.description: One coefficient trading day (leap year)

arguments.name: EASTER
arguments.description: Easter holiday

arguments.name: SCEASTER
arguments.description: Statistics Canada Easter

arguments.name: LABOR
arguments.description: Labor Day

arguments.name: THANK
arguments.description: Thanksgiving

arguments.name: TDSTOCK
arguments.description: Stock trading day

arguments.name: SINCOS
arguments.description: Fixed seasonal

arguments.name: USERVAR=
arguments.description: Specifies variables in the PROC X12 DATA= data set that are to be used as regressors.

arguments.name: B=
arguments.description: Specifies initial or fixed values for the regression parameters in the order in which they appear in the PREDEFINED= and USERVAR= options. An F immediately following the numerical value indicates that this is not an initial value, but a fixed value.

arguments.name: USERTYPE=
arguments.description: Enables a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined variable.
arguments.help: USERTYPE=AO | CONSTANT | EASTER | HOLIDAY | LABOR | LOM | LOMSTOCK | LOQ | LPYEAR | LS | RP | SCEASTER | SEASONAL | TC | TD | TDSTOCK | THANKS | USER

arguments.name: AO
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined AO variable.

arguments.name: CONSTANT
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined CONSTANT variable.

arguments.name: EASTER
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined EASTER variable.

arguments.name: HOLIDAY
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined HOLIDAY variable.

arguments.name: LABOR
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LABOR variable.

arguments.name: LOM
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LOM variable.

arguments.name: LOMSTOCK
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LOMSTOCK variable.

arguments.name: LOQ
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LOQ variable.

arguments.name: LPYEAR
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LPYEAR variable.

arguments.name: LS
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined LS variable.

arguments.name: RP
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined RP variable.

arguments.name: SCEASTER
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined SCEASTER variable.

arguments.name: SEASONAL
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined SEASONAL variable.

arguments.name: TC
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined TC variable.

arguments.name: TD
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined TD variable.

arguments.name: TDSTOCK
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined TDSTOCK variable.

arguments.name: THANKS
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined THANKS variable.

arguments.name: USER
arguments.description: Specifies a user-defined variable to be processed in the same manner as a U.S. Census predefined USER variable.

statements.name: TABLES
statements.description: The TABLES statement enables you to alter the display of the PROC X12 tables. You can specify the display of tables that are not displayed by default by PROC X12, and the NOSUM option enables you to suppress the printing of the period summary line in the time series tables.

arguments.name: A19
arguments.description: [Prior adjustments and regARIMA components (optional)] RegARIMA outlier adjusted original data

arguments.name: C20
arguments.description: [inal estimates of irregular component weights and trading day regression factors] Final extreme value adjustment factors

arguments.name: D1
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Modified original data, D iteration

arguments.name: D7
arguments.description: [Final estimates of seasonal, trend cycle, and irregular components] Preliminary trend cycle, D iteration

arguments.name: E1
arguments.description: [Analytical table] Original data modified for extremes

arguments.name: E2
arguments.description: [Analytical table] Modified seasonally adjusted series

arguments.name: E3
arguments.description: [Analytical table] Modified irregular series

arguments.name: NOSUMMARYLINE
arguments.description: Applies to the tables available for output in the OUTPUT Statement. By default, these tables include a summary line that gives the average, total, or standard deviation for the historical data by period. The NOSUM option suppresses the display of the summary line in the listing. Also, if the tables are output with ODS, the summary line is not an observation in the data set. Thus, the output to the data set is only the time series, both the historical data and the forecast data, if available.

statements.name: TRANSFORM
statements.description: The TRANSFORM statement transforms or adjusts the series prior to estimating a regARIMA model. With this statement, the series can be Box-Cox (power) transformed. The "Prior Adjustment Factors" table is associated with the TRANSFORM statement. Only one option can appear in the TRANSFORM statement.

arguments.name: FUNCTION=
arguments.description: Specifies the transformation to be applied to the series prior to estimating a regARIMA model. The default is FUNCTION=NONE.
arguments.help: FUNCTION=NONE | LOG | SQRT | INVERSE | LOGISTIC | AUTO

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Specifies no transformation. This is the default.

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: Specifies logarithmic transformation.

arguments.name: SQRT
arguments.description: Specifies square root transformation.

arguments.name: INVERSE
arguments.description: Specifies inverse transformation.

arguments.name: LOGISTIC
arguments.description: Specifies logistic transformation.

arguments.name: AUTO
arguments.description: Uses selection based on Akaike’s information criterion (AIC) to decide between a log transformation and no transformation.

arguments.name: POWER=
arguments.description: Transforms the input series, Yt, by using a Box-Cox power transformation.

statements.name: USERDEFINED
statements.description: The USERDEFINED statement is used to identify the variables in the input data set that are available for user-defined regression. Only numeric variables can be specified. Note that specifying variables in the USERDEFINED statement does not include the variables as regressors.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: The VAR statement is used to specify the variables in the input data set that are to be analyzed by the procedure. Only numeric variables can be specified. If the VAR statement is omitted, all numeric variables are analyzed except those that appear in a BY statement, ID statement, INPUT statement, USERDEFINED statement, the USERVAR= option of the REGRESSION statement, or the variable named in the DATE= option in the PROC X12 statement.

statements.name: X11
statements.description: The X11 statement is an optional statement for invoking seasonal adjustment by an enhanced version of the methodology of the Census Bureau X-11 and X-11Q programs. You can control the type of seasonal adjustment decomposition calculated with the MODE= option.

arguments.name: FINAL=
arguments.description: Lists the types of prior adjustment factors, obtained from the regression and outlier statements, that are to be removed from the final seasonally adjusted series.

arguments.name: AO
arguments.description: Additive outliers

arguments.name: LS
arguments.description: Level change and ramp outliers

arguments.name: TC
arguments.description: Temporary change outliers

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: All outliers

arguments.name: FORCE=
arguments.description: Specifies that the seasonally adjusted series be modified.

arguments.name: TOTALS
arguments.description: To force the yearly totals of the seasonally adjusted series and the original series to be the same.

arguments.name: ROUND
arguments.description: To adjust the seasonally adjusted values for each calendar year so that the sum of the rounded seasonally adjusted series for any year equals the rounded annual total.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: To first force the yearly totals, then round the adjusted series.

arguments.name: MODE=
arguments.description: Determines the mode of the seasonal adjustment decomposition to be performed.

arguments.name: ADD
arguments.description: Additive mode of the seasonal adjustment decomposition

arguments.name: MULT
arguments.description: Multiplicative mode of the seasonal adjustment decomposition

arguments.name: LOGADD
arguments.description: Log-additive mode of the seasonal adjustment decomposition

arguments.name: PSEUDOADD
arguments.description: Pseudo-additive mode of the seasonal adjustment decomposition

arguments.name: OUTFORECAST
arguments.description: Determines whether forecasts are included in certain tables sent to the output data set. If OUTFORECAST is specified, then forecast values are included in the output data set for tables A6, A7, A8, A9, A10, B1, D10, D10B, D10D, D16, D16B, and D18. The default is not to include forecasts.

arguments.name: SEASONALMA=
arguments.description: Specifies which seasonal moving average (also called seasonal "filter") be used to estimate the seasonal factors. These seasonal moving averages are n x m moving averages, meaning that an n-term simple average is taken of a sequence of consecutive m-term simple averages.
arguments.help: SEASONALMA=S3X1 | S3X3 | S3X5 | S3X9 | STABLE | X11DEFAULT | MSR

arguments.name: S3X1
arguments.description: A S3X1 moving average.

arguments.name: S3X3
arguments.description: A S3X3 moving average.

arguments.name: S3X5
arguments.description: A S3X5 moving average.

arguments.name: S3X9
arguments.description: A S3X9 moving average.

arguments.name: STABLE
arguments.description: Stable seasonal filter.

arguments.name: X11DEFAULT
arguments.description: A 3X3 moving average is used to calculate the initial seasonal factors in each iteration, and a 3X5 moving average to calculate the final seasonal factors

arguments.name: MSR
arguments.description: Filter chosen automatically by using the moving seasonality ratio of X-11-ARIMA/88

arguments.name: SIGMALIM=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower and upper sigma limits in standard deviation units which are used to identify and down-weight extreme irregular values in the internal seasonal adjustment computations. One or both limits can be specified. The lower limit must be greater than 0 and not greater than the upper limit. If the lower sigma limit is not specified, then it defaults to a value of 1.5. The default upper sigma limit is 2.5. The comma must be used if the upper limit is specified.

arguments.name: TRENDMA=
arguments.description: Specifies which Henderson moving average be used to estimate the final trend cycle. Any odd number greater than one and less than or equal to 101 can be specified. Example: TRENDMA=23. If no selection is made, the program selects a trend moving average based on statistical characteristics of the data. For monthly series, a 9-, 13-, or 23-term Henderson moving average is selected. For quarterly series, the program chooses either a 5- or a 7-term Henderson moving average.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the method used to calculate the final seasonally adjusted series (Table D11). The default method is TYPE=SA.

arguments.name: SA
arguments.description: Assumes that the original series has not been seasonally adjusted.

arguments.name: SUMMARY
arguments.description: The trend cycle, irregular, trading day, and holiday factors are calculated, but not removed from the seasonally adjusted series. Thus, for TYPE=SUMMARY, Table D11 is the same as the original series.

arguments.name: TREND
arguments.description: trading day, holiday, and prior adjustment factors are removed from the original series to calculate the seasonally adjusted series (Table D11) and also are used in the calculation of the final trend (Table D12).
